question.title: Will Alex Jones face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings are initiated against Alex Jones, as confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If no such new proceedings are initiated by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Columbia University officially announces the removal of any individual's name from any of its campus buildings due to public pressure. question.title: Will Rand Paul publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on healthcare funding?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Rand Paul publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on healthcare funding. A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

This question will receive a YES response if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona successfully carries out a public referendum aimed at instituting protections for abortion rights in the state. For a YES determination:

1. The public referendum must be officially announced and carried out by the authorities of Arizona.
2. The public referendum must directly address the issue of protecting abortion rights.
3. The results of the public referendum must be communicated through official state channels or credible news sources.

A NO response will be given if:

1. No such public referendum occurs before August 31, 2024.
2. A planned public referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A public referendum takes place, but it does not specifically focus on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This question focuses solely on whether the public referendum occurs within the specified timeframe, regardless of the outcome.

question.title: Will the NFL officially announce plans to use AI for game strategy analysis by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the National Football League (NFL) officially announces a plan to use AI technology for analyzing game strategies. The announcement must come from an official NFL source, such as a press release, official statement, or announcement during an NFL event. The plan should specifically state the intention to implement AI technology for game strategy analysis. The announcement must be reported by at least two major sports news outlets (e.g., ESPN, NFL.com, Sports Illustrated, The Athletic). question.title: Will the Taiwan Weighted Index reach or exceed 20,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Taiwan Weighted Index reaches or exceeds 20,000 points. question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

para_P.title: Will NASA's Orion spacecraft achieve a crewed return flight from the ISS prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion spacecraft successfully completes a crewed return flight from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive answer:

1. The flight must involve the Orion spacecraft transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS to Earth.
2. The spacecraft must land safely with all crew members in good condition.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another reputable space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by a minimum of two major, trustworthy news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will be answered with a NO if:
- No such flight occurs by the specified date.
- A flight is attempted but fails to meet all the criteria listed above.
- The Orion spacecraft is only used for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return trip.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return flights from the ISS are relevant for the answer.

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

question.title: Will the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India formally declares a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes a reduction of more than 20% in the budget of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget cut is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget cuts do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

question.title: Will Elim Chan be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Elim Chan is officially recognized and announced by at least two reputable music industry publications or organizations as the youngest music director of a major orchestra. The recognition must be based on her age at the time of her appointment to a major orchestra, such as the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. A 'major orchestra' is defined as a professional symphony orchestra with international recognition and a regular concert season. The recognition must explicitly state that she is the youngest person to hold such a position. If no such recognition occurs by the specified date, or if another conductor is recognized as younger in such a role, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mandatory wellness program by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mandatory wellness program for beneficiaries. The wellness program must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

The wellness initiative must be a fundamental part of the program. For a positive answer, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid department, or credible reporting from at least two reputable national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially implemented, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state implements such a program by July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will the first phase of a major Native American drone delivery project in Texas be completed by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the first phase of a large-scale drone delivery project planned by a Native American tribe in Texas is completed. The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. question.title: Will Darden Restaurants announce plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Darden Restaurants (the parent company of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and other restaurant chains) officially announces plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements, regulatory filings (such as SEC filings), or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). The announcement of intent to acquire is sufficient for a YES resolution; the acquisition does not need to be completed by this date. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Belarus withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus publicly announces the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous retraction of Belarus's application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus joins the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Belarus will retract its request to be a part of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus makes a public declaration of its intention to retract its request to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. This declaration must be validated by official communications from the Belarusian government and covered by at least two credible international news agencies (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The retraction must be a definitive and clear withdrawal of Belarus's request to join the organization, rather than a mere delay or reconsideration. If such a declaration is not made by the resolution date, or if Belarus becomes a member of the organization before the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Texas state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Texas regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially organizes a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and carried out by the Texas state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly relate to the matter of protecting abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communication or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or delayed past the mentioned date.
3. A public vote is conducted, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not evaluate the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

question.title: Will the average weekly jobless claims in the U.S. fall below 200,000 for any month by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is at least one calendar month where the average weekly jobless claims in the United States fall below 200,000. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. question.title: Will Moscow announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a declaration regarding a public transport-exclusive policy for the venues of the 2026 World Cup in Moscow by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or a designated representative of the municipal government makes a declaration indicating that all locations for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will only be reachable via public transportation. The declaration must be issued through official means (such as a press conference, formal statement, or the city government’s website) or covered by at least two major news organizations. The policy should clearly express the intent to limit access to World Cup venues for private vehicles, thereby encouraging the use of public transport. question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI research lab's chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Microsoft's AI chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Microsoft's AI chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will South Africa's National Council of Provinces pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Ramaphosa by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Africa's National Council of Provinces passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Cyril Ramaphosa or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the National Council of Provinces, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Ramaphosa or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the South African economy.

If no such bill is passed by the National Council of Provinces by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Utah Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Utah Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Utah legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will Oscar Mayer issue a recall of hot dogs due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oscar Mayer officially announces a recall of any of its hot dog products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Oscar Mayer's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Oscar Mayer
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning an Oscar Mayer recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that Baidu's donation is being used to cover full tuition for all engineering students at Zhejiang University, regardless of their family income. question.title: Will Switzerland's SMI index reach or exceed 12,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Switzerland's SMI index reaches or exceeds 12,500 points. The 12,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the SIX Swiss Exchange. If the index does not reach 12,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 12,500 points.

question.title: Will Florida implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Florida has officially implemented a free community college plan. question.title: Will Bank of India issue pass-through certificates worth at least $1 billion by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bank of India issues pass-through certificates with a total value of at least $1 billion (or its equivalent in Indian Rupees) as part of a loan sale. The issuance must be confirmed through official announcements by Bank of India or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The pass-through certificates must be issued as part of a strategy to manage the bank's loan portfolio or address funding gaps. If no such issuance meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, or if the total value is less than $1 billion, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

This question will be answered in the affirmative if, by August 31, 2025, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum aimed at instituting protections for abortion rights in the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public referendum must be officially announced and carried out by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The public referendum must specifically address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the public referendum must be reported by official state communications or well-known news organizations.

The question will receive a negative response if:

1. No such public referendum takes place by August 31, 2025.
2. A planned public referendum is canceled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A public referendum occurs, but it does not specifically focus on establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcomes of the public referendum, only whether it occurs within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Israel in response to military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Israel specifically in response to the Israeli military's decision to send draft notices to ultra-Orthodox men. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across Israel. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of military draft notices for ultra-Orthodox men. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the draft notice policy is rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Russia announce an exceptional yield for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially announces an exceptional yield for both wheat and sunflowers, signifying yields that are above the average compared to the last five years. An exceptional yield is characterized as a crop output that is considerably higher than average, usually at least 10% greater than the five-year average. Validation must come from official announcements by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If an exceptional yield is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no exceptional yield is reported for either crop, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Sweden announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Swedish government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of the Environment, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

It is crucial to understand that the actual date for the implementation of the rate decrease may be after December 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the main monetary policy tool utilized by the Central Bank of Indonesia.

question.title: Will France's CAC 40 index reach or exceed 7,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, France's CAC 40 index reaches or exceeds 7,500 points. The 7,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Euronext Paris. If the index does not reach 7,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 7,500 points.
